channel.title: tor installs itself on debian ?
channel.description: I powered on whonix-gateway. And made new virtualmachine so all networking goes trough whonix-gateway. I used net-install iso to install new debian 9. I choose to install bare minimum debian os. When i did "service --status-all" i noticed that tor service is running. How is that ? Does debian installer somehow decides to install tor because i routing installation over whonix-gateway ? If i install without gateway, there is no tor installed on debian.

item.title: tor installs itself on debian ?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I can’t imagine Debian installer has code to detect a Tor connection let alone being behind a Whonix-Gateway.

However this isn’t a Whonix question and could be sorted as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle.

Read full topic

item.title: tor installs itself on debian ?
item.dc:creator: userfame
item.description:
I powered on whonix-gateway. And made new virtualmachine so all networking goes trough whonix-gateway. I used net-install iso to install new debian 9. I choose to install bare minimum debian os. When i did “service --status-all” i noticed that tor service is running. How is that ? Does debian installer somehow decides to install tor because i routing installation over whonix-gateway ?
If i install without gateway, there is no tor installed on debian.

Read full topic
